chunks.content:
#### **High performance Qcells N-type solar cells**

Q.ANTUM NEO solar cell technology with optimized module layout boosts module efficiency up to 22.8 %.

metadata.section_title: High performance Qcells N-type solar cells

chunks.content:
#### **A reliable investment**

Inclusive 25-year product warranty and improved 30-year linear performance warranty1

#### **Enduring high performance**

Long-term yield security with Anti LeTID Technology, Anti PID Technology2 , Hot-Spot Protect.

#### **Extreme weather rating**

High-tech aluminium alloy frame, certified for high snow (5400 Pa) and wind loads (2400 Pa).

#### **Innovative all-weather technology**

Optimal yields, whatever the weather with excellent low-light and temperature behaviour.

#### **Far beyond the standard**

Qcells' comprehensive quality program ensures high long-term yields and the reliability of your solar system.

- <sup>1</sup> See data sheet on rear for further information.
- <sup>2</sup> APT test conditions according to IEC / TS 62804-1:2015, method A (−1500 V, 96 h)

**Mechanical Specification – Q.TRON S‑G3R.12+‑BFG 440‑455**

The Q.TRON S‑G3R.12+‑BFG 440‑455 module measures **1762 mm in length, 1134 mm in width, and 30 mm in thickness**, the latter dimension including the protective frame. The complete assembly has a **mass of 20.9 kg**.

- **Front Cover:** The front surface is composed of **1.6 mm‑thick thermally pre‑stressed glass** that incorporates **anti‑reflection technology** to reduce glare and improve light transmission.  
- **Back Cover:** The rear side is protected by **1.6 mm‑thick semi‑tempered glass**, offering a balance of strength and flexibility.  
- **Frame:** The surrounding frame is fabricated from **black anodised aluminium**, providing corrosion resistance and a durable, aesthetically consistent enclosure.  

- **Solar Cells:** The module contains **six rows of sixteen monocrystalline Q.ANTUM NEO half‑cells**, for a total of 96 half‑cells, delivering high efficiency and power output.  

- **Junction Box:** The integrated junction box measures **53 mm to 67 mm in length, 28 mm in width, and 17 mm in height**. It is rated **IP68**, ensuring protection against dust ingress and continuous immersion in water. The box includes **bypass diodes** to maintain performance under partial shading conditions.  

- **Cable:** Two solar cables, each with a cross‑sectional area of **4 mm²**, are provided. The **positive (+) cable** has a minimum length of **≥ 1265 mm**, and the **negative (‑) cable** also has a minimum length of **≥ 1265 mm**.  

- **Connector:** The module is equipped with a **Stäubli MC4‑Evo2A connector**, which is also rated **IP68**, matching the junction box’s ingress protection level.  

No additional mechanical items are listed beyond those detailed above.

**Electrical Characteristics – Product Q.TRON S‑G3R.12+‑BFG (Model range 440 – 455 W)**  

The following description presents every specification listed in the “Electrical Characteristics” table for the four power‑class variants (440 W, 445 W, 450 W, and 455 W). All values are given for the minimum performance under Standard Test Conditions (STC) with a power‑tolerance of **+5 W / −0 W**.

---

### 1. Minimum Performance at STC (Standard Test Conditions)

| Parameter (definition) | Unit | 440 W Variant | 445 W Variant | 450 W Variant | 455 W Variant |
|--------------------------|------|--------------|--------------|--------------|--------------|
| **Power at Maximum Power Point (P<sub>MPP</sub>)** | [W] | 440 W | 445 W | 450 W | 455 W |
| **Short‑Circuit Current (I<sub>SC</sub>)** | [A] | 15.89 A | 15.92 A | 15.95 A | 15.98 A |
| **Open‑Circuit Voltage (V<sub>OC</sub>) – Minimum** | [V] | 35.35 V | 35.55 V | 35.75 V | 35.95 V |
| **Current at Maximum Power Point (I<sub>MPP</sub>)** | [A] | 14.83 A | 14.87 A | 14.91 A | 14.95 A |
| **Voltage at Maximum Power Point (V<sub>MPP</sub>)** | [V] | 29.67 V | 29.93 V | 30.19 V | 30.44 V |
| **Module Efficiency (η)** | [%] | ≥ 22.0 % | ≥ 22.3 % | ≥ 22.5 % | ≥ 22.8 % |

*All values represent the minimum guaranteed performance for each power class.*

---

### 2. Additional Technical Notes

1. **Bifaciality**  
   - The bifaciality factor for both **P<sub>MPP</sub>** and **I<sub>SC</sub>** is **80 % ± 10 %**.  
   - This bifaciality rating is specified for rear‑side illumination **on top of the STC front‑side irradiation** (i.e., the rear receives additional light while the front side remains under the standard 1000 W/m², 25 ± 2 °C, AM 1.5 spectrum).  

2. **Measurement Tolerances (IEC 60904‑1‑2)**  
   - The measurement tolerances for **P<sub>MPP</sub>**, **I<sub>SC</sub>**, and **V<sub>OC</sub>** are **± 3 %** when tested under STC conditions (1000 W/m², 25 ± 2 °C, AM 1.5).  

3. **Reference Standards**  
   - All performance figures conform to **IEC 60904‑3**, which defines the testing methodology for photovoltaic modules.

---

### 3. Summary by Power Class (Condensed View)

- **440 W Model**: P<sub>MPP</sub> = 440 W, I<sub>SC</sub> = 15.89 A, V<sub>OC</sub> ≥ 35.35 V, I<sub>MPP</sub> = 14.83 A, V<sub>MPP</sub> = 29.67 V, η ≥ 22.0 %.
- **445 W Model**: P<sub>MPP</sub> = 445 W, I<sub>SC</sub> = 15.92 A, V<sub>OC</sub> ≥ 35.55 V, I<sub>MPP</sub> = 14.87 A, V<sub>MPP</sub> = 29.93 V, η ≥ 22.3 %.
- **450 W Model**: P<sub>MPP</sub> = 450 W, I<sub>SC</sub> = 15.95 A, V<sub>OC</sub> ≥ 35.75 V, I<sub>MPP</sub> = 14.91 A, V<sub>MPP</sub> = 30.19 V, η ≥ 22.5 %.
- **455 W Model**: P<sub>MPP</sub> = 455 W, I<sub>SC</sub> = 15.98 A, V<sub>OC</sub> ≥ 35.95 V, I<sub>MPP</sub> = 14.95 A, V<sub>MPP</sub> = 30.44 V, η ≥ 22.8 %.

All figures are the **minimum guaranteed values** under the defined test conditions, and the stated tolerances and bifaciality factors must be considered when evaluating real‑world performance.

**Minimum performance of the Q.TRON S‑G3R.12+‑BFG 440‑455 under normal operating conditions (NMOT2)**  

All values listed below are the minimum guaranteed specifications measured at an irradiance of **2 800 W · m⁻²**, under **NMOT (Normal Module Operating Temperature)**, with an **AM 1.5** spectral distribution.

| Parameter (symbol) | Unit | Minimum value at **PMPP = 332 W** | Minimum value at **PMPP = 336 W** | Minimum value at **PMPP = 340 W** | Minimum value at **PMPP = 344 W** |
|---------------------|------|-----------------------------------|-----------------------------------|-----------------------------------|-----------------------------------|
| **Short‑circuit current** | ISC | 12.83 A | 12.85 A | 12.88 A | 12.90 A |
| **Open‑circuit voltage** | VOC | 33.65 V | 33.84 V | 34.03 V | 34.22 V |
| **Current at maximum power point** | IMPP | 11.97 A | 12.01 A | 12.04 A | 12.07 A |
| **Voltage at maximum power point** | VMPP | 27.74 V | 27.98 V | 28.24 V | 28.51 V |

**Interpretation of the data**

- At a minimum power‑at‑maximum‑power‑point (PMPP) of **332 W**, the module delivers a short‑circuit current of **12.83 A**, an open‑circuit voltage of **33.65 V**, a maximum‑power‑point current of **11.97 A**, and a maximum‑power‑point voltage of **27.74 V**.
- When the minimum PMPP rises to **336 W**, the corresponding minimum values are **12.85 A (ISC)**, **33.84 V (VOC)**, **12.01 A (IMPP)**, and **27.98 V (VMPP)**.
- At a minimum PMPP of **340 W**, the module’s minimum specifications become **12.88 A (ISC)**, **34.03 V (VOC)**, **12.04 A (IMPP)**, and **28.24 V (VMPP)**.
- Finally, for a minimum PMPP of **344 W**, the minimum guaranteed figures are **12.90 A (ISC)**, **34.22 V (VOC)**, **12.07 A (IMPP)**, and **28.51 V (VMPP)**.

These figures represent the lowest performance levels that the Q.TRON S‑G3R.12+‑BFG 440‑455 photovoltaic module will meet under the specified test conditions.

metadata.section_title: MINIMUM PERFORMANCE AT NORMAL OPERATING CONDITIONS, NMOT2

chunks.content:
**Qcells performance warranty – Performance at low irradiance**

- **First‑year power guarantee:** The module must deliver **at least 98.5 % of its nominal power** during the first year of operation.  
- **Annual degradation limit:** After the first year, the warranty limits the degradation to a **maximum of 0.33 % per year**.  
- **10‑year power guarantee:** By the end of the tenth year, the module must still provide **at least 95.53 % of its nominal power**.  
- **30‑year power guarantee:** By the end of the thirtieth year, the module must retain **at least 88.93 % of its nominal power**.  

All of the above figures are stated **within the measurement tolerances** defined for the product. The full warranty terms are applied **in accordance with the warranty conditions of the Qcells sales organisation in the customer’s respective country**.

**Typical module performance under low‑irradiance conditions**  
The performance values given above refer to operation under low‑irradiance conditions and are expressed relative to the standard test conditions (STC) of **25 °C and 1000 W m⁻²**.

---

### Standard terms of guarantee for the five PV companies with the highest production capacity in 2021 (February 2021)

| Parameter                                    | Symbol | Unit   | Value |
|----------------------------------------------|--------|--------|-------|
| Temperature Coefficient of Short‑Circuit Current (I<sub>SC</sub>) | α      | % / K | **+0.04** |
| Temperature Coefficient of Open‑Circuit Voltage (V<sub>OC</sub>) | β      | % / K | **−0.24** |
| Temperature Coefficient of Maximum Power Point (P<sub>MPP</sub>) | γ      | % / K | **−0.28** |
| Nominal Module Operating Temperature (NMOT)   | –      | °C     | **45 ± 2** |

- The **temperature coefficient of I<sub>SC</sub> (α)** is **+0.04 % per kelvin**, indicating a slight increase in short‑circuit current with rising temperature.  
- The **temperature coefficient of V<sub>OC</sub> (β)** is **−0.24 % per kelvin**, showing a decrease in open‑circuit voltage as temperature rises.  
- The **temperature coefficient of P<sub>MPP</sub> (γ)** is **−0.28 % per kelvin**, reflecting the net effect on maximum power output with temperature changes.  
- The **Nominal Module Operating Temperature (NMOT)** is specified as **45 °C with a tolerance of ± 2 °C**.

These specifications constitute the complete set of performance‑warranty and temperature‑coefficient data for the Q.TRON_S‑G3R.12+‑BFG_440‑455 module as provided in the documentation.

metadata.section_title: Qcells performance warranty Performance at low irradiance

chunks.content:
**Properties for System Design – Q.TRON_S‑G3R.12+-BFG_440‑455**

1. **Maximum System Voltage**  
   - **Designation:** VSYS  
   - **Unit:** volts (V)  
   - **Specified Value:** 1500 V  
   - **Associated Classification:** The photovoltaic (PV) module is classified as **Class II**.

2. **Maximum Reverse Current**  
   - **Designation:** IR  
   - **Unit:** amperes (A)  
   - **Specified Value:** 30 A  
   - **Fire Rating:** In accordance with ANSI/UL 61730, the module carries a fire rating of **C**.

3. **Maximum Design Load (Push / Pull)**  
   - **Unit:** pascals (Pa)  
   - **Specified Values:**  
     - **Push Load:** 3600 Pa  
     - **Pull Load:** 1600 Pa  
   - **Permitted Module Temperature Range:** The module may operate from **‑40 °C to +85 °C**.

4. **Maximum Test Load (Push / Pull)**  
   - **Unit:** pascals (Pa)  
   - **Specified Values:**  
     - **Push Load:** 5400 Pa  
     - **Pull Load:** 2400 Pa  
   - **Continuous Duty:** No specific value is provided for continuous‑duty operation in the table.

# **Qualifications and Certificates**

TÜV NORD; IEC 61215:2016; IEC 61730:2016. This data sheet complies with DIN EN 50380.
